p: Olasupo et al., ( 2003) reported that the minimum concentration of carvacrol required to inhibit the growth of E. coli (1.5 mmol/L) was greater than the concentration required to inhibit the growth of Salmonella (1 mmol/L), and this indicates that Salmonella is more sensitive to carvacrol than E. coli. Yuan et al., ( 2015) observed that the chitosan film had no antimicrobial activity against Staphylococcus, and with the addition of carvacrol and pomegranate peel extract, the antimicrobial activity against this bacterium increased, and the inhibitory effect of carvacrol on Staphylococcus was significantly greater than that of pomegranate peel extract.
